Gelerator

Generate Element in a simple, HTML-in-JS way.

        
          const { g } = require('gelerator')

          const H1 = g('h1.bold')('h1 with class: blod')
          const H2 = g('h2', { style: 'background: #ccc' })('h2 with style')
          const P = g('p.class1.class2')

          const content = g({ id: 'content' })(
              H1,
              H2,
              P('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet'),
              P('Consectetur adipisicing elit. Facilis, aliquid!')
          )

          $('.target').appendChild(content)

Installation

  • yarn
  • npm
            $  yarn add gelerator
            $  npm install gelerator

    Javascript

  • g('.btn')('click me')
  • g('button#main')('content')
  • g('#main', { style: 'color: #888' })('ctt')
  • g('img.demo-jpg')('./demo.jpg')

    Elements

  • <div class="btn">click me</div>
  • <button class="btn">content</button>
  • <div id="main" style="color: #888">ctt</div>
  • <img class="demo-jpg" src="./demo.jpg">

Generate html in js, no editor window switching.
